content.description:
A literary narrative typically features of a number of events: different kinds of episodes, scenes and encounters structure the story. Writers develop plot by deliberately and purposefully arranging events in a particular sequence.

Either from your own reading or from the list below, choose a work of fiction in which the sequence of events is manipulated in some significant way that affects the plot. Write a thesis statement that you might use for an essay that analyzes how that manipulation contributes to an interpretation of the work as a whole. Write a paragraph in support of your thesis that uses at least one piece of evidence from the text. Do not merely summarize the plot.

In your response you should do the following:

Respond to the prompt with a thesis that presents an interpretation and may establish a line of reasoning.

Select and use evidence to develop and support your line of reasoning.

Explain the relationship between the evidence and your thesis.

Use appropriate grammar and punctuation in communicating your argument.

All the Light We Cannot See

Arcadia

As I Lay Dying

Atonement

Betrayal

Cane

Catch-22

Cloud Atlas

The Color Purple

The Corrections

Ethan Frome

Finnegans Wake

Frankenstein

The Gangster We Are All Looking For

A Gesture Life

Going After Cacciato

The Good Soldier

Gulliver’s Travels

The Handmaid’s Tale

Heart of Darkness

Homegoing

How the García Girls Lost Their Accents

Howards End

Invisible Man

July’s People

M. Butterfly

Macbeth

Moby-Dick

Mumbo Jumbo

Never Let Me Go

Possession: A Romance

Praisesong for the Widow

The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie

The Reluctant Fundamentalist

The Scarlet Letter

The Secret History

Sing, Unburied, Sing

Six Degrees of Separation

Snow Flower and the Secret Fan

Tess of the d’Urbervilles

The Time Traveler’s Wife

To The Lighthouse

Wide Sargasso Sea

The Woman Warrior

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain the function of a significant event or related set of significant events in a plot.
